sentences.en: An inadequacy often calls forth compensating forces.
sentences.cn: 一种缺陷往往会产生补偿的力量.

sentences.en: Clare'sassertiveness stirred up his deep-seated sense of inadequacy.
sentences.cn: 克莱尔的敢作敢为强烈触动了他内心深处的自卑感。

sentences.en: For most companies, acquisitions still carry some stigma of inadequacy.
sentences.cn: 对于大多数公司, 并购意味着自身有缺陷.

sentences.en: In the conclusion, the inadequacy of poetic dramatization is pointed out.

sentences.en: Juvenile offenses often reflect an inadequacy in the parents.
sentences.cn: 青少年犯罪通常反映了父母的教育不当.

sentences.en: Marasmus is the condition resulting from caloric inadequacy of the diet.
sentences.cn: 消瘦是由饮食的热量不足引起的症状.

sentences.en: Persons who are greedy and selfish an overwhelming sense of inadequacy.
sentences.cn: 这个说得有点像我哦.贪婪自私的人总是无法满足.

sentences.en: She rightly points to the inadequacy of the argument.
sentences.cn: 她准确地指出这个论点的不足之处.

sentences.en: The failure is due to the inadequacy of preparations.
sentences.cn: 这次失败是由于准备不足造成的.

sentences.en: The feeling of inadequacy was overpowering.
sentences.cn: 无法胜任的感觉非常强烈。

sentences.en: Their inadequacy brings us back to the general inadequacy of the literary world of Concord.
sentences.cn: 它们的不足应归咎子康考德文艺界的贫乏.

sentences.en: To overcome this inadequacy it is most important to use additional information from family values.
sentences.cn: 为了克服这方面的不足,采用以家系为准绳的其它资料是很重要的.

sentences.en: Unemployment can cause feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem.
sentences.cn: 失业会使人缺乏自信，产生自卑感。

words.tran_cn: 不适当，不充分；不完全；不十分

trans.tran_cn: 不充分，不适当，不完全，[医]官能不足，机能不全，不十分
trans.tran_en: a feeling that you are not as good, clever, skilled etc as other people
